Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sprite
      • Block
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Block
extends Sprite
implements java.io.Serializable
    This is the class that represents a block. It is a child of Sprite and is serializable. Snake cannot pass through a block unless it makes the value of that block to zero.
    Author:
    SHUBHAM THAKRAL, TANMAY BANSAL
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Block(int[] screenCoordinates, int number)
      In the constructor, we take screenCoordinates and pass it to the super class constructor.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      This method checks if the block can be destroyed.
      void collide(Snake snake)
      This method collides the block and snake and decreases the length of the snake

      This method instantly destroys the block by making it's number = 0;
      int getNumber()
      This method returns the number on block

      This method overrides the intersects method of block and changes it so that we check the tophalf boundary of s with the bottom boundary of the block

      This method overrides the render method because we also want to display the number on the block along with its image.

      This method overrides the toString method of Sprite class

      This method defines the abstract method update of Sprite class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Block

        public Block(int[] screenCoordinates,
             int number)
        In the constructor, we take screenCoordinates and pass it to the super class constructor.
        Parameters:
        screenCoordinates - is an array of upper and lower bounds of the screen in XY plane. It is taken so that objects can know the boundaries of screen.
        number - is the number that needs to set to the block

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(double time)
        This method defines the abstract method update of Sprite class. It allows its movement only in Y direction.
        Specified by:
        update in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        time - is duration for which we want to update

      • render

        public void render(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        This method overrides the render method because we also want to display the number on the block along with its image.
        Overrides:
        render in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        gc - is the GraphicContext of Canvas where we draw the image

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method overrides the toString method of Sprite class
        Overrides:
        toString in class Sprite

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Sprite s)
        This method overrides the intersects method of block and changes it so that we check the tophalf boundary of s with the bottom boundary of the block
        Overrides:
        intersects in class Sprite
        Parameters:
        s - is the sprite with which collision needs to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the sprites intersects, else returns false

      • collide

        public void collide(Snake snake)
             throws SnakeLengthZeroException
        This method collides the block and snake and decreases the length of the snake
        Parameters:
        snake - is the snake object with which block has collided
        Throws:
        SnakeLengthZeroException - when snake dies while decreasing its length

      • canBeDestroyed

        public boolean canBeDestroyed(Snake snake)
                       throws SnakeLengthZeroException
        This method checks if the block can be destroyed. This only check whether the number on block is 1 and it can be destroyed in one iteration. This method also decreases the length of the snake if the block can be destroyed by it.
        Parameters:
        snake - is the snake object with which block has collided
        Returns:
        true if block can be destroyed, else false.
        Throws:
        SnakeLengthZeroException - if snake dies while decreasing its length

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        This method instantly destroys the block by making it's number = 0;

      • getNumber

        public int getNumber()
        This method returns the number on block
        Returns:
        number on block
